text: Ali Mroudjaé (2 August 1939 – 2 May 2019) was a Comorian politician. He served as the Foreign Minister of the Comoros from 1978 to 1982. He served as the nation's Prime Minister from 1982 to 1984. He was a member of the political party Comorian Union for Progress. == Biography == Ali Mroudjae was born on August 2, 1939 in the district of Iroungoudjani in Moroni. Ali Mroudjaé attended the École normale supérieure des lettres et sciences humaines de Lyon. After a coup by Bob Denard (1929-2007), Ahmed Abdallah presented to the government the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ali Mroudjaé in 1978. In this post, he worked until 8 February 1982 as a member of the Prime Minister of the Comorian Union for Progress. He held this position until 31 December 1984. In 2002, he ran again in the elections but only reached 4.2%. He died after a long illness on May 2, 2019 in Moroni, at the age of 79. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Prime ministers of the Comoros Category:Deaths from disease
title: Ali Mroudjaé
